cab.content:
SECRET
G.T.779
Copy No.14
WAR CABINET
Draft Reply by the Foreign Office to the Declaration of the Russian Government made on May 3rd 1917.
(Note by the Secretary)
Copies of tho Draft Reply have been ciroulated to Members of the War Cabinet. I am informed by Lord Rohert Cecil that, unless some Member of the Cabinet raises an objection to the sense and contents of the Draft, he proposes to ask the Allied Governments to assent to it.
The Draft forms one of the items on the Agenda for the Meeting of the War Cabinet to-morrow morning, but the question will not he discussed unless a Minister desires to raise some point In regard to it.
(Initialled) M.P.A.H.
2,Whitehall Gardens, S.W.
21st May,1917
